isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - REASSEMBLE - ADJUST BACKLASH OF THE RING GEAR

svcproc.title: ADJUST BACKLASH OF THE RING GEAR
svcproc.para: Refer to ADJUST BACKLASH OF THE RING GEAR for the proper setting.

note.para: Measure the outer diameter of ring gear for approximate pitch diameter ( Figure 109).

figure.caption: Figure 109. Measure Outer Diameter of Ring Gear

svcproc.para: If the old gear set is installed, adjust the backlash to the setting that was measured before the carrier was disassembled.
If a new gear set is installed, adjust the backlash to the correct specification for new gear sets.
During the check of tooth contact patterns, the backlash can be adjusted within specification limits, if needed, to change the location of the pattern.

step1.para: Attach a dial indicator on the mounting flange of the carrier ( Figure 110).

figure.caption: Figure 110. Attach and Adjust Dial Indicator

step1.para: Adjust the dial indicator so that the plunger or pointer is against the tooth surface ( Figure 110).
Adjust the dial of the indicator to zero (0).
Hold the drive pinion in position.

While you read the dial indicator, rotate the differential and ring gear a small amount in both directions, against teeth of the drive pinion. If the backlash reading is within specification, continue by checking tooth contact patterns. If the backlash reading is not within specifications, adjust backlash as needed.

note.para: Backlash is increased by moving the ring gear away from the drive pinion ( Figure 111). Backlash is decreased by moving the ring gear toward the drive pinion ( Figure 112).

step1.para: Loosen one bearing adjusting ring one notch then tighten the opposite ring the same amount.

note.para: When you adjust backlash, move the ring gear ONLY. DO NOT move the drive pinion.

step1.para: Repeat Steps 2 to 6 until the backlash is within specifications.
Preload of differential bearings - all carrier models - 15 to 35 in-lbs. (1.7 to 3.9 Nm) torque.
Expansion between bearing caps - RS-140 and RS-145 carrier models - .003 to .009 inch (.08 to .22 mm)
All other carrier models - .006 to .013 inch (.15 to .33 mm).
